SENT.plain: A child is reported with Behcet's disease who presented with skin and joint manifestations, oral ulcers, brainstem syndrome and neurogenic muscular atrophy
The neurogenic muscular atrophy was confirmed by electrophysiologic, histologic and histochemical studies
Electron microscopy of muscle showed a vasculopathy
The possible etiology of the muscle lesions is discussed
The relevant literature on muscle and peripheral nerve involvement in Behcet's disease is reviewed
It is proposed that neuromyopathy be added to the neurological manifestations of Behcet's disease
To our knowledge, this is the first case of neurogenic atrophy reported in Behcet's disease
